That next thing there -- six legs, tentacles -- that's the thing we saw in the food locker.
So the next step should be --
-- The big one.  And there it is. Out of meaningless geometric symbols on a wall, it has be to recognize each stage in the alien's life cycle.
This is all the same creature.  We're seeing the different stages in its life-cycle.
Then that tomb... must have been some kind of fertility temple... where they stored their eggs, and maybe held mating rituals...
... And Broussard got caught in their reproductive cycle.
You will notice, though, that there are no more phases.  Only four forms are shown.  After that the pattern repeats.
Which presumably means...
... More spores coming.
Faust quickly turns a couple of corners and then comes to halt when he notices that a DOOR LEADING TO THE LOWER DEC WRENCHED OFF ITS HINGES. He hesitates, uncertain what to do, then there is A SOUND

head_text.subj: DIRECTION OF THE AIR LOCK... AND THE INNER LOCK DOOR IS O

text: Faust hesitates and peers into the lock.
The creature is squatting in the middle of the floor, gna bloody thigh bone.  It does not see Faust.
Stealthfully, dropping back into the shadows, Faust press intercom and speaks into it.
(whispering)
It's in the lock -- blow the main lock.
Standard, Roby and Hunter are staring at the pictures.  T Faust catches Standard in mid-sentence.
(into intercom)
What?
(whispering)
It's in the main air lock.  Blow the lock.
Standard hesitates, starts to frame a reply -- then chang and runs to his console -- and THROWS THE SWITCH.
With a mechanical whine, the inner door starts to close. hears it and INSTANTANEOUSLY LEAPS OUT OF THE LOCK.
The creature comes flying out of the lock and DEALS FAUST

head_text.subj: HANDED BLOW, KNOCKING HIM ACROSS THE THRESHOLD OF THE AIR

text: crushing him to a thickness of about three inches. On the wall, a green light goes on:
Despite the fact that the inner door is still held open a by Faust's squashed body, THE OUTER DOOR BEGINS TO SLIDE

head_text.subj: IMMEDIATELY, THERE IS A TREMENDOUS SCREAM OF ESCAPING AIR

text: In dead silence, a thick spurt of steam comes out of the door.  This is the ship's atmosphere freezing as it squir the vacuum under pressure.
INSTANTLY, A TREMENDOUS WINDSTORM STARTS UP as the ship's sucked out toward the lock.

head_text.subj: A SIREN BEGINS TO SOUND, AND A RED LIGHT FLASHES

text: After a moment of panic and confusion, Roby bolts out of room.
Loose papers and articles of furniture hurtle through the as Roby hurries toward the rock, partly running, partly s by the air current.
A huge plume of steam grows from the side of the ship, wi of tiny loose particles tumbling out in it.
Whipped by the hurricane wind, Roby crashes to a momentar against a wall.  As he hesitates there, trying to regain

head_text.subj: HE SEES THE CREATURE SCURRYING AWAY DOWN ANOTHER CORRIDOR

text: Ignoring the monster, he pushes off from the wall and sta again.

Roby stops himself by grabbing the edge of a doorway at t hall down from the airlock.  Here, the wind is really ter clothes flap on his body and all kinds of things fly by - is a DEAFENING WHISTLE. Instantly, Roby starts turning a large wheel, which begin sliding hatch door, closing off the air lock corridor.  A closes, THE CURRENT DECREASES, THEN IS FINALLY CUT OFF AS Done in, he collapses to the floor. Then he clutches his throat and begins to gasp for breath the thinness of the air, THE SOUND LEVEL IN THE SHIP IS V THIN, DISTANT, ALMOST INAUDIBLE.  Roby is gasping loudly, barely hear him; and his footsteps boom thinly like a man underwater.

Clutching his throat, he comes across the others -- Stand Hunter -- and they are all choking, clawing at their thro like fishes out of water.  They are sweating heavily and bleed. They try to speak to each other, but the sound is so muff only hear distant croaks. Standard mumbles something and stumbles down the hall.  T follow him.

The door bursts open and Standard reels in, his footsteps thinly on the metal flooring.  We see several rows of lar tanks, all connected by hoses to a few petcocks. Standard staggers to these and starts twisting the handle them.  THERE IS A PIERCING HISS OF ESCAPING AIR, AND THE GRADUALLY RETURNS TO NORMAL as Standard and the others si floor, gasping in the oxygen gratefully. Finally they have recovered enough to be able to sit up.
How much oxygen did we lose? Standard rises unsteadily and peers at the gauges.
We've got six hours left.
(groans)
Oh my God.
Does anybody know what happened?
I saw it.  Faust got himself jammed in the air lock door.  His body held it open.
Can we get to him?
No, I had to seal off a whole section.  We'd lose too much of our remaining air if we opened the connecting door.
Faust's body, crushed in the inner door, floats weightles vacuum.  His nose and mouth are crusted with huge gobs of
The three survivors -- Standard, Roby and Hunter -- slump The cat emerges from a hiding place, yowling with fear.
(picking up the cat)
Poor kitty; puss puss puss.
At least we're rid of the damn monster.  It must have been the first thing sucked out of the ship.
No such luck.  I saw it running down one of the corridors.
(groans)
Oh no!  We can't fight this thing! There's only six hours of air left -- we're dead men!
I don't buy that.  There's still time to destroy it and get ourselves in the freezers.
How
It's time for drastic remedies.
It was time for that a couple days ago.
That kind of remark is pointless. Now come on -- I want to hear every suggestion you can come up with, no matter how wild.
We can't kill it on board.  It's huge now and must have tremendous amounts of that acid in its body.
I've got an idea, but you're not going to like it.
Let's hear it.
Okay.  First we shut down all the cooling systems on the stardrive engines.
That'll blow the ship up.
Right... but it'll take a few minutes for the engines to overheat and melt down the core.  In the meantime, we get in the lifeboat and leave the ship.
Blow the ship up?
And the creature with it.  We can make it back to Irth in the lifeboat.
But the lifeboat can't accelerate to light speed.
Doesn't matter -- we're already at light speed.  And when we get back to the Colonies, they'll pick us up in the network.
What about all the minerals and elements in the cargo hold?  That's the only reason we came out here. We'd have to abandon them all.  We'd be broke.
Our lives are more important. Anyway, we can take a small amount of the most valuable stuff with us on the lifeboat.
No, it won't work and I just realized why.  There's only one hypersleep freezer on the lifeboat. Only one of us could survive.
Yeah... I forgot.
But the idea's good, if we could just turn it around somehow. They think.
If we could just get the  creature into the lifeboat, we could launch it into space and blow it up.
Good!  That's good!
We can load the lifeboat up with explosives and trigger them remotely, once the lifeboat is in space.
I think it's going to be almost impossible to drive it up into the lifeboat.
We can use the flamethrower.
It's not going to work.
You can't say that; I think it's a good plan.
The flamethrower needs more fuel.
Right.  We've got a lot to accomplish.  Let's get moving.
The three men come down steps into this rather dirty area A lot of tools and large items of machinery are stored ar

text: SHAPES.  Each container is well packed and labelled.
Which explosive should we use?

I'd suggest the N-13 sticks.  They're portable, and they can be radio detonated. Hunter begins to unlock a locker and draw out long, red s broomhandles, with tiny printing on them. Meanwhile, ROBY IS STARING AT THE ROWS OF METAL CANNISTER one of them.
You know, it's funny -- this stuff we went to so much trouble to dig up -- this treasure, the paydirt -- it'll make it back to Irth just fine -- even if we're not with it.
Here, carry these. Hunter takes an armload of the red broomsticks, and stumb
(grabbing at him)
Hey watch it
(grinning)
It's stable; it doesn't hurt to drop it. They begin to carry the explosives up the steps.
The three men are carrying their equipment along the hall Hunter's tracker suddenly BEEPS.
Hold it! They all stop.  The tracker BEEPS AGAIN.  Hunter puts dow points the tracker around.
(nodding up some steps)
Up there. They all look at each other.  Standard puts down his bund up the flamethrower.
So what do we do?  Do we ignore it and finish loading the explosives into the boat -- or do we flush it out now?
Now.  If we can get it into the boat, we won't have to blow it up -- we can just eject it into space. Standard hefts the flamethrower and starts up the steps.
Standard's face is tense as he advances up the circular s Suddenly, a METALLIC TAPPING SOUND is heard.  He freezes. Then he continues up.

The view of interstellar space is spectacular.  As Standa the steps, the METALLIC TAPPING is heard again. Standard looks around.  Then he sees it -- BROUSSARD'S CO OUTSIDE THE GLASS OF THE DOME.  It is tangled in some rig movement of the machinery causes the cadaver to tap on th periodically.
(shouts)
You can come up!  It's safe! The others come up the steps.
(spying the corpse)
Oh -- Jesus -- Broussard's corpse is blue and bloated where the wrapping loose.  Bumping against the glass, he looks like he wants
The ship's gravitational attraction must have drawn him back.
(horrified)
Should we go outside and bring him in?
No... the risk is too great.  Perhaps after we've destroyed the thing. Glancing back, the men retreat from the observation dome. remains against the glass, peering in with dead eyes.

The floor slopes upward slightly here as the corridor fun ends in the entrance to a narrow passageway or crawl-way. passageway connects the nose of the ship with the lifeboa The three men come up to the entrance to the passageway, equipment.  They duck in and walk the short distance to t

The passageway connects into the rear of the lifeboat.  I extremely simple, stripped-down vehicle; even the metal s beams-are exposed.  A single hypersleep freezer takes up of floor space.  It is an escape-craft, nothing more.
(pointing)
Along the base of the walls there. They begin to stack the red broomsticks against the base on both sides of the lifeboat, and to wire them into posi
This should do it.
I should hope so!  And we'd better make sure it's pretty far from the ship when we blow it.
It will be.
(surveys the craft uneasily)
What we really need is some red meat in here for bait.
Well, if we had some, I'd eat it. I'm starting to get hungry. By this time, they are exiting.
Well... now we have to herd that thing up here.
(nervously)

Whoever's doing the herding is gonna have their hands pretty full.  I think somebody should stay by the lifeboat to slam the door on the thing once it's inside, and to serve as... as...  (searches for a word)
Isn't "bait" the word you used?
Hey look, somebody has to have his hands free to lock the creature in the lifeboat!
Yes, and maybe launch the boat and blow it too... if the others are injured.

Who gets the privilege? INSERT: THREE CRUMPLED PIECES OF PAPER.  Three hands pick ANGLE ON ROBY.  He unfolds his paper, turns it so the oth it.  It has a big X on it. ANOTHER ANGLE - SHORTLY LATER.  Hunter is showing Roby a like a transistor radio.
Just keep your finger off the button till she's way away from the ship, that's all.
Is it armed?
If you press the button right now, it will blow the whole nose of the ship off.
Thanks for the thought. (puts detonator in his breast pocket)
All right, Martin, we'll be in touch with you on the communicator.
And you'll let me know when you've got it coming this way...
And you stand aside while we drive it in, then shut the hatch, launch the boat, and --
Kablooey. Hunter's face twitches nervously at this.

Come on; we haven't much time, air is a factor. They leave the nose of the ship, Standard carrying the fl Hunter the tracker. Roby settles himself at the controls, runs through them b familiarize himself.  Using a switch, he opens and closes door a couple of times.  It slams open and shut quite rap He presses a few buttons and sets the launch button to "R Then STANDARD'S VOICE comes from the communicator:
(over, filtered)
We've got something on the tracker... got to be it, it's too big for the cat. This is a VERY SPOOKY SCENE, ROBY ALONE BY THE LIFEBOAT, THE VOICES ON THE COMMUNICATOR.
(over, filtered)
It's coming from down there. Roby hears various tinny sound effects, rustlings, clunki breathing, etc.
Standard has the flamethrower at the ready, and Hunter is the tracker.
It must have stopped moving.  I'm not getting anything.
Let me go first; you stay behind me. Carefully, Standard advances down the corridor.  Then THE
Standard whirls around, sees the thing clutching Hunter. off to one side, as though to keep Standard from getting Standard doesn't know what to do.
The flamethrower!
I can't, the acid will pour out! At that moment the creature TAKES A BITE OUT OF HUNTER, W MORTAL AGONY. Standard can take it no longer; he raises the flamethrowe

CATCHES THE FULL BLAST OF THE FLAME.

text: Standard instantly stops firing, but now Hunter is a kick flame, held out at arm's length by the monster.
Roby is listening to all this on the communicator.  He ca shrieks and crashing noises. Then the communicator goes dead, and all he hears is a ru

Hello?  Standard?  Hunter? He waits quite a while for a response, but we can see fro expression that he expects none. He drops his face into his hands.  When he lifts his head managed to summon a certain amount of resolve.

Roby walks along watching the tracker, carrying a pistol hand.  He comes across Standard's flamethrower, lying on picks it up, substituting it for the pistol. Then he continues to follow the tracker; it takes him dow into the maintenance level.

Roby follows the device for a short distance until it ind the source of the signal is directly under his feet.  Loo sees that he is standing on a square metal plate. Getting down on his hands and knees, he removes the heavy revealing a black opening with a ladder going down. Substituting the tracker for a flashlight, but still carr flamethrower, Roby starts down the ladder.
Shining the light around into the darkness, Roby descends ladder to the floor.

head_text.subj: THE PLACE IS A HORRIBLE LAIR, FULL OF BONES, HAIR, SHREDS

text: Something moves in the darkness -- Roby turns his light o HANGING FROM THE CEILING IS A HUGE COCOON.  It appears to some fine, white, silk-like material, and it is slowly un Flamethrower ready, Roby approaches the cocoon.  As he ge enough, he sees that the cocoon is semi-transparent and T STANDARD IS INSIDE IT. Unexpectedly, Standard's eyes open, and focus on Roby -- violently.
(a feeble whisper)
Kill me...
(sickened)
What did it do to you?
(moves his head slightly)

Look...  Roby turns his light where Standard indicates.  Another c from the ceiling, but this one looks a little different. and darker, with a harder shell.  In fact, it looks almos THE SPORES IN THE TOMB.
(whispering)
That was Melkonis... it ate Hunter...
(looking around for a tool)
I'll get you out of there.
No... don't...
But I can save you -- get you to the Autodoc!
No good... it's eaten too much of me...
(in horror)
What can I do?

Kill me...  Roby stares at him in horror, then bends down and takes a at him.  REACTING, he straightens back up, raises the fla sprays a molten blast.  When the entire room is in flames scrambles back up the ladder.
Roby drops to his knees and gasps for breath, trying not At length, he regains control of himself.
The SNARK appears to hang motionless, with planets and st rolling past in the infinite distance.
Roby is putting the cat into a metal, vacuum-sealed catbo little oxygen tank on it.

Kitty go bye-bye. He seals the catbox, then turns on the oxygen.  There is of pressurized air.  Wild-eyed, the cat peers out of a li front.  It YOWLS. He picks up the pressurized catbox and leaves the bridge.
Carrying the catbox and a shoulder bag (and of course the flamethrower), Roby goes quickly to the nearest rank of m cannisters.
(reading from labels)
What'll it be, Kitty?  Here -- how about some Tacitum-35, ten kilos of it.  This'll buy us an island on some nice planet. Putting the invaluable cannister into the shoulder bag, h back up the steps.

Catbox in one hand, flamethrower in the other, Roby enter room, containing the massive stardrive engines. He puts down his parcels and approaches the main control engines.  Studying the instructions, he begins to close s by one. A SIREN BEGINS TO HONK THROUGHOUT THE SHIP.

Attention!  The cooling units for the stardrive engines are not functioning!  Engines will overload in 4 minutes, 50 seconds!  Attention! Finally Roby closes the last switch.  Shaking with nervou hurriedly picks up catbox, bag and flamethrower and hurri engine room.
Roby hurries on, listening to the siren.
Attention!  Engines will overheat and main core will melt in 4 minutes, 30 seconds!
Roby comes hustling up to where the lifeboat is berthed. he starts to enter the connecting passageway.

head_text.subj: THE CREATURE IS WAITING AT THE OTHER END OF THE PASSAGEWA

text: It HISSES and starts toward him.
Roby leaps out of the passageway, bounds to the controls, the switch.  The hatch door SLAMS SHUT, locking the thing lifeboat.

Attention!  Engines will overload in 4 minutes! Indecisive, Roby stares at the lifeboat "LAUNCH" button. be heard fumbling around in the passageway. Finally, he turns and bolts back toward the engine room.
Like a maniac, Roby runs through the ship, level after le down stairwells, his footsteps clanging metallically thro ship as he sprints for the engine room.
Attention!  Engines will overload in 3 minutes, 30 seconds!

The door crashes open and Roby comes running in.  The roo smoke and the engines are whining dangerously.  It is ext the room; Roby instantly breaks out in sweat. He runs to controls and begins throwing back on the cooli switches. Still THE SIREN CONTINUES.
Attention!  Engines will overload in 3 minutes! Roby pushes a button and speaks into it.
Computer!  I've turned all the cooling units back on!  What's wrong?
The reaction has proceeded too far. The core has begun to melt.  Engines will overload in 2 minutes, 35 seconds. A look of terror comes onto Roby's face.  He turns and ru engine room.
Again, Roby must run through all the levels of the ship, up the stairs, exhausted, stumbling, while the computer coun
Attention!  Engines will overload in 2 minutes!

Reeling, gasping for breath, Roby staggers into the vesti the lifeboat is berthed.  He grabs the flamethrower and t the passageway. It is then he realizes that THE LIFEBOAT DOOR IS OPEN AGA Quickly, he glances around to see if the creature might b Then he advances on the passageway.
Dripping with sweat, his face a mask of fear, Roby enters passageway, flamethrower gripped tightly in his hands.  H by the siren and the computer:
Attention!  Engines will explode in 90 seconds! He makes it all the way to the end of the passageway, the head into the lifeboat.
HIS POINT-OF-VIEW as he quickly scans the lifeboat, revea EMPTY.
Immediately, he turns and dashes back to the head of the There he grabs the catbox and bag, then runs back into th
Attention!  Engines will explode in 60 seconds!
He comes in on the run, hurls the catbox and bag toward t does a dive over the back of the control chair.  He is no seat than he hits the "LAUNCH" button.
The retainer clips drop away, and with a blast of ramjets

head_text.subj: LIFEBOAT IS LAUNCHED AWAY FROM THE "SNARK."

text: Roby is frantically strapping himself in, as the lifeboat away from the mother ship.
The tiny pod of the lifeboat accelerates away from the la the SNARK.  The scene is strangely serene for such deadly circumstances.
Roby finishes strapping himself in, then he reaches and g catbox.  The cat is YOWLING.  Roby hugs the box to his ch his head down over it.
The SNARK drifts ever farther away as the lifeboat leaves until it is barely a point of light. THEN IT BLOWS UP.

head_text.subj: AN EXPANDING ORANGE FIREBALL WITH PIECES OF METAL FLYING

text: The shockwave hits the escape craft, jolting it and rattl everything inside.  Then all is quiet. Roby unhooks himself from his straps, rises, and goes to the lifeboat.  He stares out through the porthole.  His f in orange light.
What he sees is the boiling fireball, now fading and fizz into nothingness, and a couple of pieces of debris floati
Roby's expression is mournful as he watches the final obl his ship and friends.

head_text.subj: BEHIND HIM, THE CREATURE EMERGES FROM SOME HIDING PLACE -

text: The cat SCREECHES. Roby whirls, and finds himself facing the thing across th the boat.  It squats, then pulls out its trophy -- a man' It begins to eat the arm, watching Roby. His first thought is for the flamethrower -- unfortunatel the floor right next to the monster.  Next he glances aro place to hide.  His eye falls on a tiny locker containing with the door standing open. He begins to edge toward the locker.  The creature rises. It throws down the arm.  With that, Roby dives for the op door, hurls himself inside, and slams the door shut.

There is a clear glass panel in the door, and the thing p right up to the glass, peering in at Roby.  The locker is Roby's face is only inches away from the creature's.  The disgusting.  It turns its head, looking at him in curiosi Then the MOANING OF THE CAT distracts it.
The creature waddles over to where the pressurized catbox bends down and peers inside.  The CAT YOWLS LOUDER. It picks up the catbox in its tentacles.

Trying to distract the monster away from the cat, Roby TA GLASS. But the monster reacts so fast that its face is instantly glass, startling the hell out of Roby. Getting no more interference from him, the thing returns catbox. Roby looks around.  He spies the spacesuit.  Quickly, he it on.
The creature picks the catbox up in its tentacles and sha if there is anything inside.  The cat MOANS.
Roby is halfway into the pressure suit.

The creature throws the catbox down.  It clangs, and boun picks it up again and hammers it against the wall.  Then into a crevice in the wall. With one tentacle, it begins to pound the sealed catbox i crevice.  The cat has gone beyond hysterics.

Roby pulls on the helmet, latches it into place, then tur oxygen.  With a hiss, the suit fills itself. In a rack on the wall is a long metal rod with a blunt ru Roby peels the rubber off, revealing a sharp steel point. Again he raps on the glass.
The creature turns.  It faces the locker, peers at him.
Try a little of this, you fucking bastard. HE KICKS THE DOOR OPEN.

The creature rises, but just in time to catch THE STEEL S THROUGH ITS MIDRIFF. IT MAKES A HORRIBLE NOISE AND CLUTCHES AT THE SPUR.  The begins to flow from the wound. Before the acid can touch the floor, Roby reaches back an switch -- BLOWING THE REAR HATCH. In a poof, the tiny atmosphere in the lifeboat is sucked space -- and the bleeding creature along with it.  Roby g strut to keep from being sucked out, but as the creature WRAPS THE END OF A TENTACLE AROUND HIS ANKLE.
Roby is now hanging halfway out of the lifeboat, with the clinging to his leg.  He kicks at it with his free foot, let go.

Looking for any salvation, Roby grabs the hatch control l yanks it. The hatch slams shut, closing Roby safely inside but TRAP OF THE CREATURE'S TENTACLE IN THE DOORJAMB. It instantly releases Roby, who staggers back.
The creature is now outside the lifeboat, in the vacuum, the tip of its tentacle caught in the closed hatch.
Where the tentacle is caught in the hatch, it is wounded, starting to foam with acid, eating away at the metal. Roby stumbles forward to the controls and pushes a lever
The jet exhausts are located at the rear of the craft, ri creature is wriggling.  THE ENGINES BELCH FLAME FOR A FEW SHUT OFF. INCINERATED, THE CREATURE TUMBLES SLOWLY AWAY INTO SPACE.
Roby hurries to the rear hatch and looks out after the th

The burned mass of the monster drifts slowly away into sp writhing, smoking, foaming mass. As it tumbles into the distance, pieces drop off it -- it then bursts, soggily, sending a spray of particles off in directions.  The last we see of it is a few smouldering r into infinity.
The boat is re-pressurized and Roby is seated in the cont seems calm and composed, almost cheerful.  The cat purrs
(dictating)

... So it looks like I'll make it back to the Colonies on schedule after all.  I should be to the frontier in another 250 years or so, and then with a little luck the network will pick me up.  I'm not as rich as I was a couple days ago -- but I'm not exactly broke either. Incidentally, I did manage to salvage one souvenir out of this whole mess. He reaches down into the carrying bag he brought on board out the ALIEN SKULL.

Poor Yorick here should go at least partway toward proving I'm not a crank.  I wish it was him we'd met in the first place -- things might have turned out different. He puts the skull down on a shelf and locks a glass lid o

This is Martin Roby, executive officer, last survivor of the commercial vessel SNARK, signing off. Come on, cat, let's go to sleep. Roby leans forward and switches off the recorder.  Then h carrying the cat, walks to the hypersleep freezer, which He climbs in and stretches out on his back, holding the c his chest.  With one hand, he presses a switch, and THE L HIM. CLOSE-UP OF THE ALIEN SKULL, watching sentinel over the s Roby like some dead, melancholy pixie.

The lifeboat -- SNARK 2 -- sails away toward its rendezvo 250 years from now. As SNARK 2 drifts past camera, we suddenly see that A SPO ADHERED TO THE UNDERBELLY OF THE CRAFT. ROLL END TITLES & MUSIC.
